Sentencas: The Sr2FeNbO6 (SFNO) compound is a material with potential applications to be used as an electrode in solid oxide fuel cells, as well as a photocatalyst material for hydrogen generation.
Titulo: DFT study on the electronic and magnetic properties of the Sr2FeNbO6 compound

Sentencas: However, there is much controversy on the crystal structure related to this compound.
Titulo: DFT study on the electronic and magnetic properties of the Sr2FeNbO6 compound

Sentencas: Establishing a crystal structure that correctly describes the electronic and magnetic properties presented by this compound is important to understand the origin of its properties.
Titulo: DFT study on the electronic and magnetic properties of the Sr2FeNbO6 compound

Sentencas: Theoretical DFT calculations were performed on the cubic, tetragonal, and orthorhombic structure based on the generalized gradient approximation (GGA) and the corrected local density of Hubbard approximation (LDA + U).
Titulo: DFT study on the electronic and magnetic properties of the Sr2FeNbO6 compound

Sentencas: Our results reveal that the orthorhombic and tetragonal structures are suitable models for reproducing an A-type AFM arrangement and an indirect energy band gap for SFNO in agreement with the reported experimental results if U-Fe = 10 and 9 eV are used respectively.
Titulo: DFT study on the electronic and magnetic properties of the Sr2FeNbO6 compound

Sentencas: Meanwhile, the cubic structure does not reproduce the SFNO properties since this modeled structure exhibits a metallic and ferromagnetic behavior.
Titulo: DFT study on the electronic and magnetic properties of the Sr2FeNbO6 compound
